row.process:
! Sets the agent for the Job with the following logic: ! Helper: Agent directly set on JOB :SET &DIRECT_AGENT# = GET_ATT(HOST)
! Helper: Agent set on promptset/prompt :SET &OVERWRITE_RA_AGENT# = GET_SCRIPT_VAR("OVERWRITE_RA_AGENT_PROMPT#")
! If an overwrite agent was specified - it will be used in any case :IF &OVERWRITE_RA_AGENT# <> '' : P Agent was set via promptset to: &OVERWRITE_RA_AGENT# : PUT_ATT HOST = &OVERWRITE_RA_AGENT# :ENDIF
! If ! 1. an agent was directly set on the object ! 2. and no overwrite agent was specified ! then the agent of the object is used :IF &DIRECT_AGENT# <> '<CIT>' : IF &OVERWRITE_RA_AGENT# = '' : P Agent was set directly without overwrite: &DIRECT_AGENT# : ENDIF :ELSE ! If ! 1. no agent was set on the object ! 2. and no overwrite agent was specified ! then the first active RA Webservice agent is used. ! If no active agent can be found then the first inactive agent is used. : IF &OVERWRITE_RA_AGENT# = '' : P Trying to set Agent to first active RA WEBSERVICE AGENT : SET &HND# = PREP_PROCESS_AGENTGROUP(PCK.AUTOMIC_RA_REST.PRV.HOSTG.W,"*",ALL) : PROCESS &HND# : SET &GROUP_AGENT_NAME# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&HND#,1) : SET &STATUS# = GET_PROCESS_LINE(&HND#,2) : IF &STATUS# = 'Y' : SET &ACTIVE_AGENT# = &GROUP_AGENT_NAME# : P "Found active Agent: &ACTIVE_AGENT#" : TERM_PROCESS : ENDIF : P "Found Agent: &GROUP_AGENT_NAME# but is not active." : ENDPROCESS : CLOSE_PROCESS &HND#
: IF &ACTIVE_AGENT# = '' ! No active RA Webservice Agent found. : IF &GROUP_AGENT_NAME# = '' ! No RA Webservice Agent found on the system. : STOP NOMSG, 50, "No RA Webservice Agent found." : ENDIF : ENDIF
: IF &ACTIVE_AGENT# = '' : P "Setting Agent to: &GROUP_AGENT_NAME# (inactive)" : PUT_ATT HOST = &GROUP_AGENT_NAME# : ELSE : P "Setting Agent to: &ACTIVE_AGENT#" : PUT_ATT HOST = &ACTIVE_AGENT# : ENDIF : ENDIF :ENDIF
